questions.question: Iron Man is the first film released in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
questions.explanation: Iron Man, released in 2008, is the first film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and introduced the character of Tony Stark.

questions.question: Thor is the king of Asgard.
questions.explanation: Thor, the Norse god of thunder, is portrayed as the king of Asgard in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.question: Black Widow's real name is Natasha Romanoff.
questions.explanation: Black Widow, portrayed by Scarlett Johansson, is known by her real name Natasha Romanoff in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.question: Captain America's shield is made of adamantium.
questions.explanation: Captain America's shield is made of vibranium, a fictional metal found in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.question: The Avengers first assembled in the film 'Avengers: Age of Ultron'.
questions.explanation: The Avengers first assembled in the film 'The Avengers', released in 2012. 'Avengers: Age of Ultron' is the sequel to the first Avengers film.

questions.question: Thanos is the main antagonist in 'Avengers: Endgame'.
questions.explanation: Thanos, portrayed by Josh Brolin, is the main antagonist in 'Avengers: Endgame', the culmination of the Infinity Saga in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.question: Black Panther is the ruler of the fictional country Wakanda.
questions.explanation: Black Panther, also known as T'Challa, is the ruler of the technologically advanced fictional country Wakanda in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.question: Hawkeye's real name is Clint Barton.
questions.explanation: Hawkeye, portrayed by Jeremy Renner, is known by his real name Clint Barton in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

questions.question: Ant-Man can shrink and also increase his size.
questions.explanation: Ant-Man, portrayed by Paul Rudd, has the ability to shrink down to the size of an ant and also increase his size, thanks to the Pym Particles.

questions.question: The Infinity Stones are powerful artifacts that each represent a different element of the universe.
questions.explanation: The Infinity Stones are powerful artifacts that each represent a different aspect of the universe, such as Space, Mind, Reality, Power, Time, and Soul.
